.
When a Marriage Between Same-Sex Individuals Does Not Meet the One Year Marriage Requirement
Certain same-sex surviving spouses have faced a legal impediment in qualifying for survivor benefits when their marriage to the Veteran does not meet the one year marriage date requirement due to unconstitutional laws.
Instruction of the Secretary 01-22- Instructions for Determining Whether Same-Sex Surviving Spouses Satisfy Duration of Marriage Requirements
signed on October 11, 2022, allows the VA to recognize the duration for a marriage between individuals of the same-sex as fulfilling statutory and regulatory marriage requirements for Survivors Pension and DIC when the surviving spouse married the Veteran on or before June 26, 2017, and provides verification that they
were married to the Veteran at the time of the Veteran’s death, and
cohabitated with the Veteran and held themselves out to the public as being in a committed relationship for a minimum of one year prior to the Veteran’s death.
Important
:  If the Veteran and the same-sex surviving spouse were married after June 26, 2017, the marriage dates requirement of
38 CFR 3.54
apply.
Reference
:  For more information on the evidence required for cohabitation and holding themselves out to the public, see
M21-1, Part VII, Subpart i, 2.D.11.c
and
d
.
